Patrick L. McCRORY, et al.
v.
Philip E. BERGER, et al. No. 113A15-1. Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 29, 2015. John R. Wester, David C. Wright, III, Andrew A. Kasper, Charlotte, Robert C. Stephens, Jr., Chief Legal Counsel, Jonathan R. Harris, Associate General Counsel, for McCrory, Patrick L., Governor. John H. Culver, III, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Matthew T. Houston, Brian C. Fork, Raleigh, Robert William Manoso, for Philip E. Berger. (Pres. Pro Tem.) Alexander McC. Peters, Special Deputy Attorney General, Ann W. Matthews, Special Deputy Attorney General, Melissa L. Trippe, Special Deputy Attorney General, for Coal Ash Management Commission. C. Elizabeth Hall, Raleigh, for Carolinas AGC, et al. Robert F. Orr, Asheville, for North Carolina Institute for Constitutional Law. E. Hardy Lewis, Raleigh, for Berry, Cherie, et al. Arch T. Allen, III, Raleigh, for Arch T. Allen, III. Allegra Collins.

Opinion

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 5th of June 2015 by Arch T. Allen, III for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of June 2015."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
